info.title: API V1
info.description:
A RestFull API for Decidim, to be able to CRUD resources from Decidim.

## Authentication
[Get a token](https://octree-gva.github.io/decidim-rest-full/category/authentication) from our `/oauth/token` routes,
following OAuth specs on Credential Flows or Resource Owner Password Credentials Flow.

### Permissions
A permission system is attached to the created OAuth application, that is designed in two levels:

- **scope**: a broad permission to access a collection of endpoints
- **abilities**: a fine grained permission system that allow actions.

The scopes and abilities are manageable in your System Admin Panel.

### Multi-tenant
Decidim is multi-tenant, and this API supports it.
- The **`system` scope** endpoints are available in any tenant
- The tenant `host` attribute will be used to guess which tenant you are requesting.
  For example, given a tenant `example.org` and `foobar.org`, the endpoint
  * `example.org/oauth/token` will ask a token for the example.org organization
  * `foobar.org/oauth/token` for foobar.org.

tags.name: OAuth
tags.description:
Use OAuth to get tokens and interact with the API. You can use machine-to-machine tokens, or user token directly with the API.
* **Machine-to-machine**: Client Credential Flow
* **User**: Resource Owner Password Credential Flow, with **impersonation** or **login**

tags.name: System
tags.description: Get information about the organization and the participants.

tags.name: Public
tags.description: Discover informations about overall decidim (spaces and components)

credentialFlowBearer.description:
Authorization via service-to-service credentials flow.
Use this for machine clients.
[Learn more here](https://octree-gva.github.io/decidim-rest-full/user_documentation/auth/client-credential-flow)

resourceOwnerFlowBearer.description:
Authorization via resource owner flow.
Use this for user-based authentication
[Learn more here](https://octree-gva.github.io/decidim-rest-full/user_documentation/auth/user-credentials-flow)

error.description: Error title, starting with HTTP Code, like 400: bad request

translated_prop.title: Translated data
translated_prop.description: Hash with translated data, key=locale value=translation

edition_date.title: Last Update Date
edition_date.description: Last update date, in ISO8601 format.

blocked.description: If the user is blocked, and need to be unblocked to signin

locked.description: If the user is locked, and need to click on the mail link to unlock

name.description: User name, use to display the Profile identity. Public

nickname.description: User nickname, unique identifier for the user. Public

personal_url.description: Personal website URL or social link. Public

about.description: Short bio of the user. Public

locale.description: User locale. Fallback to default locale of the organization. Private

user_extended_data_response.title: Extended data response for a given path

user_extended_data.title: User extended data
user_extended_data.description:
Hash of values attached to a user. These values won't be
displayed to admins or users, consider this as an internal
data payload.

participatory_space_type.description: Associate space class name. Part of the polymorphic association (participatory_space_type,participatory_space_id)

participatory_space_id.description: Associate space id. Part of the polymorphic association (participatory_space_type,participatory_space_id)

updated_at.description: Last update date of the component

can_create_proposals.description: If the current user can create proposal (component allows, and user did not reach publication limit)

can_vote.description: If the current user can vote on the component

can_comment.description: If the current user comment on the component

geocoding_enabled.description: If the component needs a map to display its resources

attachments_allowed.description: If the component allows to attach files to resources

self.description: API URL to the blog post

blog_response.title: Details of a given blog post

publishable.description: Draft is published as it is now?

draft_proposal_response.title: Details of a given draft proposal

active.description: If the token can be used

aud.description: Where this token can be used (organization host)

introspect_response.description: Details about the token beeing used

grant_type.description: Resource Owner Password Credentials (ROPC) Flow, for **user impersonation**

username.description: User nickname, unique and at least 6 alphanumeric chars.

id.description: User id, will find over id and ignore username. Fails if register_on_missing=true.

register_on_missing.description: Register the user if it does not exists. Default: false

accept_tos_on_register.description: Accept the TOS on registration, used only if register_on_missing=true. Default: false

skip_confirmation_on_register.description: Skip email confirmation on creation, used only if register_on_missing=true. Default: false

email.description: User email to use on registration. used only if register_on_missing=true. Default to <username>@example.org

name.description: User name. Used only if register_on_missing=true. Default to username

grant_type.description: Resource Owner Password Credentials (ROPC) Flow, for **user login**
Resource Owner Password Credentials (ROPC) Flow, for **user impersonation**

username.description: User nickname, unique and at least 6 alphanumeric chars.

id.description: User id, will find over id and ignore username. Fails if register_on_missing=true.

register_on_missing.description: Register the user if it does not exists. Default: false

accept_tos_on_register.description: Accept the TOS on registration, used only if register_on_missing=true. Default: false

skip_confirmation_on_register.description: Skip email confirmation on creation, used only if register_on_missing=true. Default: false

email.description: User email to use on registration. used only if register_on_missing=true. Default to <username>@example.org

name.description: User name. Used only if register_on_missing=true. Default to username

grant_type.description: Resource Owner Password Credentials (ROPC) Flow, for **user login**

post.summary: Request a OAuth token throught ROPC
post.description: Create a oauth token for the given scopes

value.error_description: User not found. To create one, user meta.register_on_missing
User not found. To create one, user meta.register_on_missing
The authorization server encountered an unexpected condition which prevented it from fulfilling the request.

delete.description: Withdrawn a draft proposal. This action cannot be undone.

get.description: Detail a draft proposal. Raise HTTP 404 error if no draft is created for now.

put.description:
This endpoint allows you to create or update a draft proposal associated with your application ID.
Drafts created via this API are not visible in the Decidim front-end, and drafts created from the Decidim application are not editable through the API.
Therefore, any draft you create here is new and tied to your application's credentials.

### Example Request

```http
PUT /public/assemblies/12/2319/proposals/draft
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_IMPERSONATION_TOKEN

{
  "title": "My valid title"
}
```
## Access Requirements

* Authentication: This endpoint requires an impersonation token. You must create drafts on behalf of a participant; drafts cannot be created using a service token (credential_token).

## Error Handling

* Field Errors: Only errors related to the fields you're updating will be returned.
* Publishable Status: To determine if the draft is publishable, check the data.meta.publishable field in the response.

### Example response
```json
{
  "data": {
    "id": "12345",
    "type": "proposal",
    "attributes": {
      "title": "My valid title",
      "body": null
    },
    "meta": {
      "publishable": false
    }
  }
}
```
In this example, the title is valid, so the server returns a 200 OK status.
However, since the body is blank, meta.publishable is false, indicating that the draft is not yet ready for publication.

title.fr: This is a valid proposal title sample

locale.description: Locale of the draft. default to user locale

data.description: Payload to update in the proposal

get.description: List or search components of the organization

schema.title: manifest_name not IN filter
schema.description: match none of _manifest_name_'s values in array

schema.title: manifest_name IN filter
schema.description: match one of _manifest_name_'s values in array

schema.title: participatory_space_id IN filter
schema.description: match one of _participatory_space_id_'s values in array

schema.title: participatory_space_type IN filter
schema.description: match one of _participatory_space_type_'s values in array

get.description: List or search spaces of the organization. Can be processes, assemblies, or any other registred participatory space.

schema.title: manifest_name not IN filter
schema.description: match none of _manifest_name_'s values in array

schema.title: manifest_name IN filter
schema.description: match one of _manifest_name_'s values in array

schema.title: title not IN filter
schema.description: match none of _title_'s values in array

schema.title: title IN filter
schema.description: match one of _title_'s values in array

schema.title: title present filter
schema.description: _title_ is not null and not empty

get.description: Get detail of a space given its manifest and id
List or search users of the organization

schema.title: nickname not IN filter
schema.description: match none of _nickname_'s values in array

schema.title: nickname IN filter
schema.description: match one of _nickname_'s values in array

schema.title: nickname present filter
schema.description: _nickname_ is not null and not empty

parameters.name: filter[extended_data_cont]
parameters.description: Search on user extended_data. use the format: `"<key>":<space>"<value>"`
